required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Autologous Stem Cells for Urinary Incontinence: Single Patient Compassionate Use
clinical_study.official_title: Autologous Stem Cells for Urinary Incontinence: Single Patient Compassionate Use

brief_summary.textblock: Determine safety and effectiveness of the technique using autologous stem cells in the treatment of urinary incontinence in one male subject.

detailed_description.textblock: Autologous stem cells will be obtained from the subject by needle biopsy, sent to a lab for multiplication and after about 6 weeks time will be injected into the subjects urethra.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life (QOL) Described by the Patient's Response on the Patient Global Assessment of Severity (PGI-S) Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: The PGI-S is comprised of two questions. Question 1 asks the patient to describe how their urinary tract condition is now. Responses are 1 Normal, 2 Mild, 3 Moderate and 4 Severe. Question 2 asks the patient "If you were to spend the rest of your life with your urinary condition just the way it is now, how would you feel about that?" Responses are 1 Delighted, 2 Pleased, 3 Mostly Satisfied, 4 Mixed, 5 Mostly Dissatisfied, 6 Unhappy and 7 Terrible.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life (QOL) Described by the Patient's Response on the Global Response Assessment (GRA)
secondary_outcome.description: The GRA measures overall improvement with therapy. The patient's response describes their current condition compared to before they were treated. Responses are: 1 Markedly Improved, 2 Moderately Improved, 3 Slightly Improved, 4 No Change, 5 Slightly Worse, 6 Moderately Worse, and 7 Markedly Worse.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life (QOL) Described by the Patient's Response on the Patient Global Impression of Improvement (PGI-I)
secondary_outcome.description: The PGI-I is a global index used to rate the response of a condition to a therapy. The patient's response describes their current condition compared to before they were treated. Responses are: 1 Very Much Better, 2 Much Better, 3 A Little Better, 4 No Change, 5 A Little Worse, 6 Much Worse, and 7 Very Much Worse.

arm_group.description: Muscle Biopsy and Injection of autologous stem cells

intervention.description: Biopsy of thigh muscle to obtain stem cell core.
After autologous stem cells have multiplied over 6 weeks time they are injected into the subjects urethra.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- urinary incontinence
- failed urinary incontinence (UI) treatments
Exclusion Criteria:
- does not meet inclusion criteria, gender and age limit

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: This is a single patient compassionate use treatment.
